comments.author: Zestros Alumides

comments.text:
I'm assuming you've never, ever, ever seen the movie if you're asking who 
that was.

Her name is Murron. She was his childhood friend that he ended up marrying. 
She was then going to be raped but Wallace rescued her. Unfortunately this 
resulted in a series of events that ended with her being executed in public 
and Wallace killing nearly every English soldier garrisoned there in 
retaliation.

She is seen here again to give him comfort. He's about to die and this is 
what he sees, the love of his life. That piece of cloth he drops after 
being beheaded belonged to her.

comments.author: Dr H.

comments.text:
Win or lose your heart, you've given me truth of God's design for love.
As you know, truth sets us free.
You've freed my heart.
I believe in the world again, in people.
More than anything, in you and us.
I think you do too.
Luckily, I don't have to scream it from the rack! :-)
I can just tell you.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, Victoria Lynn.
﻿

comments.text: -Mel Gibson
comments.author: Luke Anderson

comments.text:
Anyone who isn't bawling their eyes out at the end of this MASTERPIECE has 
no heart.

I'm a heterosexual man and I honestly can not stand to watch the torture / 
beheading scene. It hurts too much.

Anyone who hates this film for its "historical inaccuracies" need to wake 
up and realize that perfectly capturing history (especially as far back as 
William Wallace's time) is IMPOSSIBLE. But, if a filmmaker can inspire the 
audience to feel the same way, over and over, then, the filmmaker and the 
film are GREAT.﻿
comments.author: Luke M
